title: eBay 'putting lives at risk' by selling hundreds of unsafe smoke alarms
text:
Smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors sold on eBay could be “putting lives at risk” with hundreds of listings for unbranded alarms that failed basic smoke and gas tests.

An investigation by Which? revealed that cheap smoke alarms listed on eBay’s “Buy it now” auction pages failed routine tests.

Seven unbranded carbon monoxide alarms failed to detect gas reliably. These unbranded alarms made up 91 of the cheapest 200 carbon monoxide detectors listed on the website.

Four unbranded smoke alarms, meanwhile, completely failed to detect smoke in tests. These made up 50 of the 200 cheapest alarms for sale.

Which? claimed eBay had “known for years that some of these products are unsafe”, with the consumer site having previously alerted them to the faulty devices earlier this year and in 2018.

Many products on eBay are sold by third party sellers or individuals and uploaded to the online auction website.
